Yes, these breathing techniques can also help with physical symptoms of stress such as muscle tension and headaches. When we are stressed, our muscles tend to tighten, and our breathing becomes shallow, which can cause headaches and other physical discomfort.

By using breathing techniques, we can increase oxygen flow to our body and reduce muscle tension, which may help alleviate headaches and other physical symptoms associated with stress.

In particular, diaphragmatic breathing and belly breathing can help relax the muscles in our abdomen and reduce tension throughout our body, while deep breathing can help reduce muscle tension in our neck and shoulders. 

Therefore, incorporating breathing techniques into our daily routine can help manage stress and its physical symptoms, making us feel more relaxed and calm.
